title: Herschel Walker vs. Barry Sanders key matchup in college football GOAT contest
text:
CLOSE

Georgia’s Herschel Walker averaged 1,746 yards per season over three collegiate seasons in 1980s. Barry Sanders had two average seasons before rushing for 2,628 yards in his final season at Oklahoma State in 1988..

Who’s the better college player? Voters will have to wrestle with that starting today through Wednesday in USA TODAY’S contest to determine the greatest college football player of all-time.

With Walker leading the way, Georgia won three consecutive SEC championships. He had a career-best 283-yard rushing day against Vanderbilt. He played with a broken thumb in his last season when Georgia.

Two Final Four spots filled, two to go.



With help from the @WeAreAFCA, we made the bracket. But we need you to vote for the best.



Our next matchup features two of the most exciting running backs of all-time. https://t.co/anbTjoFddp — USA TODAY Sports (@usatodaysports) October 14, 2019

In 1988, Sanders had four rushing games in which he rushed for more than 300 yards, including a 332-yard game against Texas Tech.

Late last week, Pittsburgh’s Tony Dorsett recorded 77% of the vote to defeat Texas sensation Earl Campbell easily advance to the Final Four where he joins

Still to come on Thursday: Michigan’s defensive back Charles Woodson vs. Tennessee quarterback Peyton Manning.
description: Tony Dorsett is into the Final Four as two more running backs face off in our quest to determine college football's greatest player.
